intro: Tapeinosperma crassum, commonly known as the broad-leaved tapeinosperma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its broad,革质 (leathery) leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, dark-colored fruits that contain seeds with a hard, woody coating. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments within forest understories.
